class_notes:
(Same as REL 320R 1 and AAS 320R 1)
(This course examines the historical religious influence of ancient African mysticisms, systems of thought, and theologies in the United States. We will observe how diverse African religious cultures have shaped social geographies, gender relations, and cultural politics in the United States. A special consideration will be given to the history, incidence, meaning, and development of Voodoo-Hoodoo in Louisiana. Also on the origins, manifestations, and expansions of Santeria, or Regla de Osha-Ifa in Florida, New Jersey and New York, as well as the cultural intersections of African and Native American religiosities in the sociocultural developments of the United States.)
